p: Clinical symptom of Mayaro fever tend to be nonspecific and include high-grade fever, debilitating arthralgia, headache, retro-orbital pain, myalgia, vomiting, diarrhea, and maculopapular rash ( 9). Similar to Chikungunya, MAYV infection can also lead to the development of long-term arthralgia ( 9). To date, no studies have shown whether individuals infected with MAYV can present as asymptomatic.
